skill.name: notebooklm
skill.description: Automate Google NotebookLM - create notebooks, add sources, generate podcasts/videos/quizzes, download artifacts. Activates on explicit /notebooklm or intent like "create a podcast about X"
skill.summary: Automate Google NotebookLM for notebook management, source integration, AI querying, and studio artifact generation
skill.author: teng-lin

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill (SKILL.md). The static analyzer incorrectly flagged markdown code blocks and documentation text as security threats. All 214 findings are false positives: backticks in markdown are formatting, not shell execution. No executable code exists in this directory.

static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Backtick characters in markdown code blocks (e.g., `notebooklm login`) are documentation formatting, not actual shell execution. This skill only contains SKILL.md documentation, no executable Python code.
Documentation example showing CLI command: `notebooklm list`. No shell execution occurs in markdown documentation.
Documentation describing configuration path `~/.notebooklm`. This is informational text about where the tool stores config, not command execution.
Documentation examples showing `-n <notebook_id>` and `--notebook <notebook_id>` flags. These are command syntax examples in markdown.
Quick reference table showing CLI commands. All backticks are markdown formatting for code examples, not executable code.
Documentation example URL `https://...` showing how to add a URL source. This is legitimate documentation, not credential exfiltration.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [HIGH] filesystem: "Hidden file in home directory" at SKILL.md:27
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Documentation describing the default config directory `~/.notebooklm`. This is standard practice for CLI tools, not malicious file access.
This is the skill name field in YAML frontmatter. The word 'MD5' does not appear on line 3. The analyzer is incorrectly flagging documentation metadata.
Documentation line 77 describes commands that require confirmation before running. This is informational text about CLI autonomy rules, not cryptographic code.
Documentation describing how to set `NOTEBOOKLM_HOME=/tmp/agent-$ID` for agent isolation. This is legitimate configuration documentation.
Documentation showing how to verify CLI setup with `notebooklm list --json`. This is standard troubleshooting documentation.

All 189 backtick findings are markdown code formatting. This skill directory contains ONLY SKILL.md documentation. The static analyzer is misconfigured for documentation-only skills and treats markdown formatting as shell execution.

content.value_statement: Automate Google NotebookLM workflows including notebook management, source integration, AI-powered chat queries, and generating studio artifacts like podcasts, videos, quizzes, and infographics.
actual_capabilities: Create, list, rename, and delete notebooks
Add sources from URLs, PDFs, YouTube videos, and Google Docs
Chat with AI about notebook sources with citations
Generate audio podcasts, videos, quizzes, and infographics
Download generated artifacts to local filesystem
Run deep web research and import findings as sources
limitations: Requires Google authentication via OAuth browser flow
Rate limits may affect audio, video, and quiz generation
Generation operations take 5-45 minutes to complete
Uses undocumented RPC APIs that Google may change

use_cases.title: Research synthesis
use_cases.description: Import multiple sources and generate audio podcasts to review findings during commute

use_cases.title: Multi-format content
use_cases.description: Transform documents into videos, quizzes, and infographics for different audiences

use_cases.title: Study aid generation
use_cases.description: Generate quizzes and flashcards from lecture notes for exam preparation

prompt_templates.title: Quick podcast
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a notebook called "{topic}" then add these sources: {sources}. Generate an audio podcast that highlights the key findings.

prompt_templates.title: Source analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Use notebook {notebook_id} to answer: {question}. Focus on {specific_sources} and cite your sources.

prompt_templates.title: Bulk import
prompt_templates.prompt: Create notebook "{name}" and add these {count} URLs as sources. Wait for processing then list all sources with their status.

prompt_templates.title: Background research
prompt_templates.prompt: Create notebook "Research: {topic}" then start deep web research on {query}. Spawn a background agent to wait for completion and import all findings.

output_examples.input: Create a podcast about machine learning from these papers
output: All sources ready. Starting audio generation...
Task ID: abc123-xyz789. Check status with: notebooklm artifact list

output_examples.input: Summarize these URLs and generate a quiz
output: Quiz generated. View at: notebooklm artifact list

output_examples.input: What are the main arguments in source abc123?
output: The main arguments are: [1] First argument point, [2] Second argument point, [3] Third argument point

best_practices: Use explicit notebook IDs with -n flag in parallel workflows to avoid context conflicts
Spawn background agents with Task tool for long-running generation operations
Check authentication status with 'notebooklm status' before starting workflows
anti_patterns: Do not rely on 'notebooklm use' in multi-agent parallel workflows
Do not poll for artifact completion in the main conversation - use background agents
Do not skip source processing wait times before generating artifacts

faq.question: How do I authenticate with NotebookLM?
faq.answer: Run 'notebooklm login' to open a browser for Google OAuth. Re-run if commands fail with auth errors.

faq.question: Can I use this in CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. Set NOTEBOOKLM_AUTH_JSON environment variable with storage_state.json contents for non-interactive auth.

faq.question: How long does audio generation take?
faq.answer: Audio generation typically takes 10-20 minutes. Use background agents to avoid blocking the main conversation.

faq.question: Why did my generation fail?
faq.answer: Google imposes rate limits on generation. Wait 5-10 minutes and retry, or use the web UI as fallback.

faq.question: What source types are supported?
faq.answer: PDFs, YouTube videos, web URLs, Google Docs, and text files. Maximum 50 sources per notebook.

faq.question: How do I download generated artifacts?
faq.answer: Use 'notebooklm download audio ./output.mp3' or 'notebooklm download video ./output.mp4' after artifact status is completed.
